document.docTitle: Trevathana dongshaensis Chan & Chen & Achituv & Lin 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of five new coral associated Barnacles of the genus Trevathana (Balanomorpha: Pyrgomatidae) in Pacific Waters

Diagnosis. ScUTUM WITH VeRy BROAD INTeRLOcKING TOOTH , TOOTH HeIGHT ABOUT 3/4 TIMeS HeIGHT Of ARTIcULAR MARGIN . POSTeRIO-LATeRAL SURfAceS Of POSTeRIOR RAMUS Of cIRRUS III BeARING ARRAy Of cONIcAL SPINeS. TeRGUM WITH INWARD TOOTH , PeRPeNDIcULAR TO BASAL MARGIN .

Description. SHeLL cOVeReD By cORAL WHeN ALIVe ( FIG. 2E, F ). SHeLL (3.5 MM BD HOLOTyPe ) fLAT, eLLIPTIcAL, PLATeS fUSeD, WHITe (AfTeR cLeANING AND PReSeRVATION), OUTeR SURfAce WITH 17 RADIATING ROWS , UP TO 5 PROjecTIONS IN ROW (17A). CIRcUMfeReNce Of BASe Of SHeLL WITH >30 SHORT PROjecTIONS, eXTeNDING BeyOND OUTLINe ( FIG. 17B ), ORIfIce eLLIPTIcAL, ROSTRO-cARINAL LeNGTH Of ORIfIce NeARLy 1/3 LeNGTH Of TOTAL ROSTRO-cARINAL DIAMeTeR. ScUTUM AND TeRGUM WHITe, SePARATeD ( FIG. 17C–F ). ScUTUM TRANSVeRSALLy eLONGATeD, TeRGAL MARGIN ABOUT 3 TIMeS LONGeR THAN OccLUDeNT MARGIN . OccLUDeNT MARGIN STRAIGHT . EXTeRNAL SURfAce Of ScUTUM WITH STRAIGHT , MeDIAN, cLOSeD fURROW ReAcHING eNTIRe LeNGTH Of ScUTUM ( FIG. 17C ). ARTIcULAR MARGIN Of ScUTUM WITH WIDe INTeRLOcKING TOOTH , TOOTH HeIGHT ABOUT 3/5 HeIGHT Of ARTIcULAR MARGIN ( FIG. 17C ). ADDUcTOR PLATe ABSeNT ( FIG. 17D ). TeRGUM SUBTRIANGULAR ( FIG. 17E, F ), ScUTAL MARGIN cONcAVe, WITH NOTcH; SPUR TRUNcATeD. EXTeRNAL SURfAce WITH SHALLOW , LONGITUDINAL , MeDIAN fURROW ( FIG. 17E ). INNeR SIDe Of ScUTAL MARGIN WITH SeMIcIRcULAR DePReSSION AccOMMODATING INTeRLOcKING TOOTH ( FIG. 17F ). INNeR SURfAce AN INWARD TOOTH LOcATeD ON SPUR , AXIS Of INTeRNAL TOOTH PARALLeL TO AXIS Of SPUR , TIP Of TOOTH eXTeNDING BeyOND BASAL MARGIN Of TeRGUM ( FIG. 17F ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 17.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
shell and opercular valves (A) External vieW (ASIZCR000356) and (B) Internal vieW (ASIZCR000355) of shell. (C) External vieW and (D) Internal vieW of left scutum (ASIZCR000355). (E) External vieW (ASIZCR000356) and (F) Internal vieW (ASIZCR000355) of left tergum. Note that for better comparisons of the internal vieW the scutum and tergum Were inclined. Scale bars in µm.

FIGURE 18.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
mouth parts. (A) Maxilla, general vieW (ASIZCR000355). (B) Serrulate setae on distal part of maxilla. (C, D) Serrulate setae on interior margin of maxilla. (E) Maxillule, general vieW (ASIZCR000355). (F) Simple setae on upper margin of maxillule. (G, H.) Large, simple setae on cutting edge and loWer margin of maxillule. Scale bars in µm.

FIGURE 19.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
mouth parts. (A) Mandible, general vieW (ASIZCR000355). (B) First and bidentate second teeth of mandible. (C) Bidentate third, fourth and simple fifth teeth of mandible. (D) Inferior angle With simple setae of mandible. (E) Mandibular palp (ASIZCR000355). (F) Serrulate setae on exterior margin of mandibular palp. (G) Labrum (ASIZCR000355). (H, I) Teeth on crest of labrum. Scale bars in µm.

FIGURE 20.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
cirri I–II (ASIZCR000355). (A) Cirrus I. (B) Serrulate setae on apex of posterior ramus apex of cirrus I. (C) Serrulate setae on apex of anterior ramus of cirrus I. (D) Serrulate setae on apex of anterior ramus of cirrus I. (E) Cirrus II. (F) Serrulate setae and conical spines on posterior ramus of cirrus II. (G) Fan-shaped denticles on posterior ramus of cirrus II (indicated by White arroWs). (H) Serrulate setae on anterior ramus of cirrus II. Scale bars in µm.

FIGURE 21.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
cirrus III–IV. (ASIZCR000355) (A) Cirrus III. (B) Posterior rami of cirrus III. (C) Anterior ramus of cirrus III. (D) Conical spines on apex of posterior ramus of cirrus III (indicated by White arroWs). (E) Serrulate setae on posterior ramus of cirrus III. (F) Cirrus IV. (G) Intermediate segment With 4 pairs of serrulate setae on cirrus IV. (H) Serrulate setae on apex of rami of cirrus IV. Scale bars in µm.

FIGURE 22.
Trevathana dongshaensis
sp. nov.
cirri V–VI and penis. (ASIZCR000355) (A) Cirrus V (B) Intermediate segment With 4 pairs of serrulate setae on cirrus V. (C) Distal segment of cirrus VI shoWing serrulate setae. (D) Cirrus VI (E) Intermediate segment With 4 pairs of serrulate setae on cirrus VI. (F) Distal segment of cirrus VI shoWing serrulate setae. (G) Penis (H). Basidorsal piont of penis. (I) Apex of penis. Scale bars in µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:

TAIWAN
.

Etymology.
Trevathana dongshaensis
IS NAMeD fROM ITS TyPe LOcALITy, DONGSHA ATOLL ,
TAIWAN
.

Remarks.
Trevathana dongshaensis
HAS AVeRy BROAD , INTeRLOcKING TOOTH ON ScUTUM, WHIcH IS SIMILAR TO THAT fOUND IN
T. paulayi
.
Trevathana dongshaensis
DIffeRS fROM
T. paulayi By
HAVING THe INTeRNAL TOOTH Of THe TeRGUM eXTeNDING BeyOND THe BASAL MARGIN .
